question: You are going to attend a training course at a college in another country. You need somewhere to live while you are there. Write a letter to the College Accommodation Officer. In your letter:•	Explain your situation •	Describe the accommodation you require •	Say when and how long you will need the accommodation
text: I hope you are doing well. My name is Mauricio Vargas and I am a student of Diploma Project Manager in Sydney´s Campus. However, I am going to participate in a course of Financial Management in Perth. Therefore, I am writing to request a habitation due to I do not have any familiar living there.

I would like a single room because I am an organize person and I do not like to share my personal space with anyone. Moreover, I would like that my habitation have a desk to study and a fridge to keep food and drinks. In addition, I would to have a book shell for my book collection because I use to read en my free time.
The course will star next Monday 31rd May, but I need to arrive one day ago to finish my enrollment. I will use the room for two week because the course will spend this time in our training.

error_list.error_des: It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
The word organize doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
The plural verb have does not appear to agree with the singular subject my habitation. Consider changing the verb form for subject-verb agreement.
The word to is usually unnecessary after the modal verb would. Consider removing it.
The word en doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
The word star doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
The word star doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
The singular noun week follows a number other than one. Consider changing the noun to the plural form.
